critique: This document pertains to civil service regulations from 1885. It focuses on the process of hiring and re-hiring within the executive branch, emphasizing fairness and apportionment based on location and sometimes sex. There's a clear attempt to regulate the hiring process to prevent abuse and ensure a degree of fairness. It is difficult to assess a political bias as it is an old document. It seems to be moderate in most aspects. The document does not seem to touch on immigration, national security, or economic regulation. It seems to be neutral on social inclusion, but it does mention sex, which could be seen as a step towards social inclusion at the time. The document seems to be neutral on federalism. The document seems to be neutral on executive power.
